channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: A 41-year-old man used a “homemade” gun to assassinate Shinzo Abe, the former prime minister of Japan, police officials said. The man was arrested and charged with murder. https://t.co/LQg3EyTGEn https://t.co/DaXNVPQx4E
Breaking News: Four Border Patrol agents are facing disciplinary action over their aggressive treatment of migrants at the border last year. https://t.co/JqzM5y28z8

Elon Musk said on Friday that he planned to terminate his blockbuster $44 billion deal to buy Twitter, after publicly indicating over months that he was dissatisfied with the agreement. https://t.co/dClbWNxhqW https://t.co/ps6AymA1vX

President Biden issued an order aiming to protect access to abortion medication and emergency contraception — but details on how those goals would be accomplished were not outlined. https://t.co/PJey7MNMpI https://t.co/suQkMs02kZ

"This is America," President Biden said after awarding the Presidential Medal of Freedom to 17 people. The recipients included Simone Biles, Denzel Washington and former Senator John McCain, who was honored posthumously. https://t.co/ZD7bABLKl6
Canadians will recognize this recipe: butter tarts. Each bite delivers three textures: flaky crust, chewy top, gooey center. https://t.co/aakrltetir https://t.co/Cxzh8KOgVm

A person in Japan must pass 12 steps before purchasing a firearm, including a written exam and a doctor's sign-off on their mental and physical health. Gun violence is almost unheard of in Japan, making Shinzo Abe's assassination even harder to fathom. https://t.co/2si1OvMY0x
Prime Minister Fumio Kishida of Japan on Friday called the fatal shooting of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe an "act of cowardly barbarism." https://t.co/FEkYw6Xo46 https://t.co/trp0qQMLGY

Shinzo Abe, Japan’s former prime minister, was assassinated as he gave a speech in the western city of Nara. A 41-year-old suspect was arrested and a crude weapon was retrieved, the police said.
Here’s a look at the scene of the attack. https://t.co/nSRBVbmFsC https://t.co/VNbe1uok4s
The symptoms of coronavirus subvariants BA.4 and BA.5 are similar to those of earlier versions of Omicron, experts said. https://t.co/WIkKYeRt9m https://t.co/hYTgcAdHYN

In Opinion
“Johnson’s career is ending, at least for now, the way Trump’s should have ended — with public revulsion leading his own party to oust him," writes Michelle Goldberg of the British prime minister. https://t.co/uBDVUCSvpk
Breaking News: The Wisconsin Supreme Court prohibited the use of most drop boxes for absentee ballots, a win for Republicans who want to limit voting access in urban areas. https://t.co/nOMoD5z1t8

The attack on former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan was especially shocking since gun violence is extremely rare in the country. Japan’s firearms law states that, in principle, firearms are not permitted. https://t.co/OajvZmScnY

President Biden said he was “stunned, outraged and deeply saddened by the news that my friend Abe Shinzo, former prime minister of Japan, was shot and killed while campaigning. This is a tragedy for Japan and for all who knew him.” https://t.co/VKtANf3QDH https://t.co/j1B1axKWOL
How many children does Elon Musk have? News reported on Wednesday brought the known total to nine. https://t.co/5GEE1TJyWI

Mourners placed flowers near the site where Shinzo Abe, Japan’s former prime minister, was assassinated in the city of Nara.
Follow our updates. https://t.co/ng1JsLS5vz https://t.co/wYxe3z4nG2

The assassination of Shinzo Abe rattled Japan and its sense of identity as a peaceful country where violent crime is rare.
“I’m shocked by this,” one woman said. “The shooting part is confusing. There are guns? In Japan?” https://t.co/slQoY2gKMd

Prime Minister Fumio Kishida of Japan condemned the killing of Shinzo Abe and praised the former leader’s achievements in peace and stability in both Japan and the world. https://t.co/0kdbVMQJsG https://t.co/ELPgrJIRGj

Shinzo Abe, Japan’s longest-serving prime minister, died on Friday after being shot. He was 67.
He helped pull his country out of economic malaise, but fell short of his most cherished goal: making Japan a normalized military power. https://t.co/rq4J0Nj1l5 https://t.co/DIdGf4gcow

Akie Abe, the wife of Shinzo Abe, arrived at the hospital where Japan's former prime minister was being treated after he was shot, according to local media.
Follow our updates. https://t.co/rGA7PSuot1 https://t.co/DQTQJZYDZO
Breaking News: Shinzo Abe, Japan’s longest-serving prime minister, was assassinated during a public speech. He was 67. A suspect was arrested. https://t.co/m82R4CByyF https://t.co/9nosZ1Jpcp

The brother of Shinzo Abe and Japan's defense minister, Nobuo Kishi, said of the attack on Abe: "Especially suppression of free speech should not be allowed in the midst of the upper house election."
"We pray for his definite recovery." https://t.co/kxweVRs3IM https://t.co/QazQ9yUm9j
Brad Pitt has said he might have prosopagnosia, a rare neurological disorder commonly referred to as face blindness. Here’s what to know about the condition. https://t.co/aAXb55NBwq

Memory decline is not inevitable with aging, neuroscientist Dr. Richard Restak argues in his latest book. Here are some of his tips for developing and maintaining a healthy memory. https://t.co/iRePACBvJ9

Videos shared on social media showed the scene moments after Shinzo Abe, Japan's former leader, was shot at a junction in the city of Nara.
This video includes scenes of graphic violence: https://t.co/7MxzFjSOkf https://t.co/kSUut1WX5a

Breaking News: Shinzo Abe, Japan's former leader, is in critical condition after being shot, Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said. Appearing emotional, he called the shooting a "heinous act."
Follow live updates. https://t.co/lYB9xKtNh2 https://t.co/fKCNA6gckO

Secretary of State Antony Blinken, who was in Bali for a Group of 20 meeting, said that he was “deeply saddened and deeply concerned” by the news that Shinzo Abe, Japan's former leader, had apparently been shot.
Follow live updates. https://t.co/QshESqu2jm https://t.co/ezgBRNj47I

Shinzo Abe, Japan's former prime minister, was unconscious after he was apparently shot in Nara, Japan, a fire official said. He appeared to be bleeding after a gunshot was heard, the broadcaster NHK said. This is a developing story.
Follow updates. https://t.co/1sSa4ntKPW

The Dallas Cowboys are facing criticism after announcing a new partnership with Black Rifle Coffee, the veteran-owned brand popular with conservatives and gun owners that sells roasts with names like “AK Espresso,” “Murdered Out” and “Silencer Smooth.” https://t.co/Emj28ZEr1Q
Breaking News: Shinzo Abe, Japan’s former prime minister, collapsed after a gunshot was heard as he delivered a speech, the country’s public broadcaster said. https://t.co/uDtIOskw3f

A subvariant of Omicron, known as BA.5, is the most transmissible variant yet of the coronavirus, and is fueling fresh outbreaks of cases and hospitalizations in many places including the U.S. https://t.co/VwLDQKVrhX

Simone Biles was one of 17 people who received the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation’s highest civilian award, on Thursday. Other recipients included the soccer star Megan Rapinoe and former Representative Gabrielle Giffords. https://t.co/9trSZFve3H https://t.co/LI4vOhR8Su

The former Cleveland police officer who killed Tamir Rice in 2014 was sworn into a new job as a police officer in a rural town in Pennsylvania. Two days later, he left the post, following a public outcry. https://t.co/5LXLevK2fY

The Kraffts, married French volcanologists, were killed on June 3, 1991, observing an eruption of Mount Unzen in Japan. But the stunning 16-millimeter footage they shot throughout their careers lives on in “Fire of Love,” an all-archival documentary. https://t.co/TfUvaEKX03

Sandra Lindsay, the New York critical care nurse who was the first American vaccinated against Covid-19 outside of a clinical trial, was presented with the Presidential Medal of Freedom on Thursday. She was one of 17 people awarded by President Biden. https://t.co/XxXw6r0k5p https://t.co/XfI76agaga
James Caan, the actor who has had roles in "The Godfather," "Misery" and "Elf," died on Wednesday. The Bronx native was 82. https://t.co/bi0RjpIq9f https://t.co/d4tUxJ11tV

Jeff Bezos won't be able to sail a superyacht through Rotterdam anytime soon. The boat's builder decided not to apply for a permit to dismantle a section of a 95-year-old bridge to allow the yacht to pass. https://t.co/8fUrLncJLM

Breaking News: Derek Chauvin, convicted of murdering George Floyd, was sentenced to 21 years for using excessive force against Floyd and a 14-year-old boy. His federal and state sentences are to be served concurrently. https://t.co/Mv5HXI6EUR

"Them's the breaks," Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain said as he resigned as Conservative Party leader.
His departure comes after a rebellion of his cabinet, a wave of government resignations and a devastating loss of party support. https://t.co/F80IyQp8KR https://t.co/Zk06VS8Ilp

Representative Mayra Flores is one of three Republican Latinas vying to transform South Texas politics by shunning moderates, embracing the far right and supporting Donald Trump. https://t.co/kpssUfGEX4
Breaking News: James Caan, the actor best known for his role as the quick-tempered Sonny Corleone in "The Godfather," died at 82. https://t.co/7MJG4Q3e7y

Breaking News: The detained U.S. basketball star Brittney Griner pleaded guilty to drug charges in Russia. She may face up to 10 years in a penal colony.
"There was no intent. I didn’t want to break the law," she said. https://t.co/bUdt4jwuJW https://t.co/DRQvRCw3C4

"The Minions aren’t voiced by celebrities. The Minions don’t make timely pop-culture references. The Minions just hit gag after gag: pure physical comedy without borders," writes Calum Marsh.
"And that’s how the Minions took over the world." https://t.co/gPOZO9rjVi

The most transmissible coronavirus subvariant yet, BA.5, is threatening a new wave of infections in the U.S., even among those who recovered from the virus fairly recently. The risk from Covid is increasing in much of the country, according to the CDC. https://t.co/LRSQENUVXD

Breaking News: Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain said he would step down once a successor was chosen. “The process of choosing that new leader should begin now,” he said.
Follow our updates. https://t.co/12Jx5dcUbF https://t.co/6Ao5KxoeQB

The parents of two girls who said their children died as a result of a “blackout challenge” on TikTok are suing the company, claiming its algorithm intentionally served the children dangerous content that led to their deaths. https://t.co/jRdEME7FMi

The population of U.S. families making more than $100,000 has grown much faster than other groups, even after adjusting for inflation, and the number of families earning less than $40,000 has increased at twice the rate as families in the middle. https://t.co/j9eAPF9vjd

Breaking News: Boris Johnson will resign as the leader of Britain’s Conservative Party, the BBC said, clearing the way for his eventual departure as prime minister.
Follow updates. https://t.co/fe9rwKZJer

There is wide agreement across the federal government that disinformation campaigns threaten to exacerbate public health crises, stoke racial divisions and undermine democracy. But a deep partisan divide has made addressing these threats nearly impossible. https://t.co/Ygs2spLzcw
Breaking News: James Comey and Andrew McCabe, former FBI officials who Donald Trump wanted prosecuted, were both subjected to rare, intensive IRS audits. https://t.co/0TiHYvn7Uy
